section.title: Known Issues
section.para: This section details known issues with this release and any workarounds that can be applied. Please report any other issues to your Citrix support representative.

entry.para: SATA legacy IDE mode Issue: Using SATA legacy IDE mode can issues accessing the emulated IDE devices in the VMs.

Workaround: The SATA configuration for the system should be setup in BIOS to use AHCI mode (the details of how to do this are system specific). This should be done prior to any of the installation steps below.

formalpara.title: AMT
formalpara.para: The use of AMT with &PB; can cause hangs and other problems when it is enabled on certain systems. To avoid these problems it is recommended that AMT (and the ME) be disabled. This is usually done using the MEBex setup which can be accessed by pressing CTRL+p during system power on. To disable AMT and the ME, enter the MEBex setup:

listitem.para: Log in using the AMT password (the default is admin if it has not been set)
Select Intel ME Configuration and Y to enter
Select Disabled then press the esc key.
The system will restart with AMT and the ME disabled.

formalpara.title: eth0 loses IP address
formalpara.para: If you lose connectivity over the eth0 interface, use udhcpc to repair the interface.

formalpara.title: Windows XP cannot be use as the Primary VM
formalpara.para: There is currently no workaround available.

formalpara.title: Secondary VMs cannot be run without a running primary VM
formalpara.para: There is currently no workaround available.

formalpara.title: Some built-in laptop speakers may not produce sound
Switching optical disks
formalpara.para: If you eject an optical disk and put in a new one Windows might not recognize that the disk has been changed. To work around this, right-click on the optical disk in Windows Explorer and select eject until the new disk is recognized.
